subject: Art & Design
title: Egyptian Pyramids: Engineering Before Machines
description: A short lesson to help you apply Egyptian Pyramids: Engineering Before Machines.

hook.text: The Great Pyramid weighs 6 million tons. It was built without wheels, iron tools, or pulleys.

buildup.text: 2.3 million limestone blocks, each weighing 2.5 tons on average, were quarried, transported, and stacked.

discovery.text: Workers used ramps, levers, and water lubrication. Organization, not magic, built the pyramids.

twist.text: They weren't built by slaves. Archaeological evidence shows they were skilled, well-fed paid laborers.

climax.text: The Great Pyramid was the tallest structure on Earth for 3,800 years. Nothing beat it until Lincoln Cathedral.

punchline.text: The pyramids aren't mysterious. They're proof of human logistics at scale.
